body.p: The Time Synchronization feature with SNTP requires the STS Ethernet connection.

li.p: 1.The Ethernet Settings on the Settings screen must be configured.
The Ethernet port must be connected to a network with a reachable time server supporting SNTP.

You must have the IP address of the time server. The time server could be a dedicated timeserver possibly with a GPS receiver, a local computer running time server software, or a timeserver on the Internet. You should preferably use a local time server. All equipment related to the STS should use the same time server if they have access.

body.p:
To have the STS use Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP), follow these steps:
Press Time button at the bottom of the screen. The TIME screen displays ().
Press the Server button. Enter the time serverâ€™s IP address.
Press the Zone button. Enter the time zone offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UCT) (-4 is Eastern Daylight time).
Make sure the Use SNTP Server checkbox has a green check. Touch Use SNTP Server to toggle between the green check (use SNTP Server) and red X (do not use SNTP Server).
Press Get to initialize time and verify that Time Synchronization is working.
Touch Set to confirm date/time.
Touch Save to save settings.
